meanings.definition: To remain undamaged or unaffected by something
meanings.sent1: The sturdy tree could withstand the strong winds.
meanings.sent2: The house was able to withstand the heavy rain without any leaks.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's suit was so strong that it could withstand even laser beams.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve to succeed was like a shield that could withstand any criticism.
meanings.sent5: The ancient castle walls stood tall, able to withstand centuries of battles.

meanings.definition: To resist or endure something without yielding
meanings.sent1: She tried to withstand the temptation to eat the delicious cake.
meanings.sent2: The athlete had to withstand the pain to finish the race.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse tried to withstand the tickles during the game of tag.
meanings.sent4: His principles were like a fortress, able to withstand any compromise.
meanings.sent5: The friendship between them could withstand any disagreement, remaining strong.
